definition: handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears

sentences.english: The "reality TV" is a new kind entertainment on telescreen .
sentences.chinese: 真人秀是近年来在电视屏幕上兴起的新的娱乐形式。

sentences.english: One of the best showcases for narcissists at the moment is reality TV.
sentences.chinese: 目前最适合自恋者表现的场合之一是电视真人秀。

sentences.english: 'There will be plenty of flesh on the show, ' she said.
sentences.chinese: 她说，这档真人秀将会充斥大量活色生香的场景。

sentences.english: The new reality show was accused of being staged.
sentences.chinese: 有人批评这个新的真人秀看上去太假。

sentences.english: The online Chinese literary scene is, in some ways, like a TV reality show.
sentences.chinese: 某种程度上，中国网络小说界有点像电视节目真人秀。

sentences.english: It's just a little reality show.
sentences.chinese: 这只是一个小的真人秀。

sentences.english: Conversely, of actor " suck eyeball " effect takes internal heat further again true person is beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 反过来，艺人的“吸睛”效应又进一步带火了真人秀。

sentences.english: I mean, there are so many reality television shows these days
sentences.chinese: 我是说，现在电视上都充斥着真人秀节目。

sentences.english: The limit is having a show in which if you lose, you die.
sentences.chinese: 一档真人秀节目的极限就是，如果你输了就得去死。

sentences.english: The ultimate is having a show in which if you lose, you die.
sentences.chinese: 一档真人秀节目的极限就是，如果你输了就得去死。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the ratings for Bonds's reality show were miserable.
sentences.chinese: 同时，邦兹的真人秀节目收视率惨败。

sentences.english: Reality shows have always featured queer folk.
sentences.chinese: 真人秀经常以同性恋人为特色。

sentences.english: Each episodes - 12 in total - are shot in a different country.
sentences.chinese: 这部真人秀共有12集，每集都在不同的国家拍摄。

definition: online variety show (contracted form of 網絡綜藝節目|网络综艺节目)
The Voice of China, PRC reality talent show
satellite TV (abbr. for 衛星電視|卫星电视[wei4 xing1 dian4 shi4])
